metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37204 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using an option element by introducing lag via an expensive computational function. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 115.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37204` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
firefox-geckodriver - 115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '115.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
